data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Doing the instructions will always lead you backwards. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first instruction, one must turn around and take 4 steps to return the same way as to turn straight from it. In the second instruction, one must turn around and take 4 steps to return the same way as to turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Once you are turned around, take four steps. If you take 4 steps, take the same amount, take 4 more. Again, if you turn back around, take the same amount, take 4 more. In order to get back to the starting point, take 6 steps first and take 4 more before turning around again. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step. Turn left. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the first turn you take 10 steps. Next you take 9 steps. The second turn is 10 steps after that. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you are returning to the starting point. If you turn left, you are moving left. If you turn around, you are going back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 8 steps and take 9 steps. You start at the beginning and go back at the end. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps away. Take 8 steps away. Take 2 steps back. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are facing forward always take 1 step left for every 2 steps you take which equals 3 steps. If you are facing towards the right then take two steps in 1 direction which equals 2 steps. If you are facing towards the left then take 4 steps in 1 direction which equals 4 step. If you are facing towards the right then take six steps in 1 direction which equals 6 step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps means you are going to turn around. 6 steps has 9 steps and 7 is the same as 3. The answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you take 1 step backward you are also going backward. Taking 1 step backward is the inverse of taking 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward while facing down you will not return to the starting point. If you face forward and are facing left you will be left facing forward. The starting point is near the beginning. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In every step of the first sequence, 3 steps are taken, 4 steps are taken, 1 step is taken, 3 steps are taken backward and 6 steps are taken. In the fourth sequence of steps, 3 steps is taken, 1 step is taken, 1 step backward and 4 steps are taken right. When you complete every stage in the order in which they are performed, you repeat the sequence twice. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If one always faces forward then one goes forward. One goes 4 steps left in this sequence. One goes 3 steps forward in this sequence. One goes 1 step right in this sequence. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are five ways to reach the starting point. Everyone takes one step backward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Right is the starting point. Turn right, right. You can take 4 steps in either direction if you follow the instructions from the starting point and turn around. In both directions, you are taking 4 steps, so you are going right. Turn around then the directions changes to turning around and taking 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around first and repeat from there. If you wanted to take your initial step, you took first and repeat from there. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 7 steps, you return to the starting point. If you take 9 steps, you return to the starting point. Turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You would only return 10 steps back if the instructions were repeating themselves. It is either turn around and take one step, take two steps or take 7 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and turn to your right. Take one step then turn right again and take 6 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right and you are back at your start point. You would take 1 more step than you took before as you went in 1st and 3rd. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 5 steps after taking 3 steps, you’re already back to the starting point. If you take 5 steps after taking 2 steps, you’re still back to the starting point. If you take 10 steps after taking 10 steps, you are back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the first step, you'll be walking back towards your starting point. The second step in the series takes you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The sentence is straight forward, but the process says you have to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person facing forward is always facing up. When one takes steps backward one should be facing forward. The third phrase is to take - as in take 7 steps backward - and take 9 steps left. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 4 steps back the same direction. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
As you always face forward, it is natural to always return to the starting point. The answer: no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right will set you back on the same direction as you arrived. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Step forward from the same starting point. Take 3 steps backward. Step forward from the same starting point. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person must take a number of steps if they are looking to return to a starting point. A person can not take multiple steps if they are looking to return to a starting point. If the person takes 4 steps then they can take 4 more steps and arrive back at the same starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person has to take 9 steps to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 8 steps right. Whenever you face right, you always get to the starting point. Whenever you are getting backwards, always step to the left. So, the answer is No.

In the first set of instructions the whole process is repeated. The last one is 5 steps and the first one is 1. In the first set the starting is turned around. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step to get backward is the first step to walk forward. The second step is the last step in the process. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 5 steps from the starting point to return to the starting point. The starting point is always facing forward. If you start facing your left, you will be taking 5 steps from the starting point to return to your right. The starting point cannot be taken when you are facing your left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
All this takes your steps forward, but you can't move backward after taking 3 steps forward. The starting point could be 8 steps backward or 4 steps backward. So, the answer is no.

The starting point is 1 and the 1st 1 is on the left. The starting point is 1 and the 8th 1 is on the right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you are facing forward, take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. If you are facing backward, take 4 steps forward. If you are facing forward, take 6 steps backward. If you are facing backward, take 1 step backward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward then you are always facing straight ahead. If you never bend forward, you will become inverted. When you take 4 steps backward, you are returning to vertical. When you take 8 steps backward, you are returning to horizontal. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The person always takes 2 steps backwards. The person always takes 4 steps backwards. The person takes 6 steps forwards. So, the answer is no.

You could say you were walking back to the beginning. The number of steps taken should be 10 steps. The starting point would be back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go backward you must take 10 steps backward. To go forward you only need 3 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The beginning position is either forward or facing backward. The direction of the direction changes once you return to the starting position. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps right. Now take 4 steps left. Now take 2 steps forward. Now take 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning left and going back to the starting point is a part of a right turn. So, the answer is Yes.

They are walking one direction in each direction. And they are facing forward. So, the answer is no.

If you always face forward, you will always move forward. If you face in the direction you are facing the first time, you would take 4 steps left and 5 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In order to return to the facing forward position, you must subsequently be facing the opposite direction. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person facing forward gets to the starting point, and can only take 4 steps forward. One who goes 1 step left will not be able to take 4 steps forward. Taking 7 and 10 steps backward have different results. So, the answer is no.
